newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LITHUANIA-GAS POSTS JAN-MAY 35.2 MLN LITAS PROFIT.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIA-GAS POSTS JAN-MAY 35.2 MLN LITAS PROFIT.

text.p: Lithuanian Gas said on Thursday that its profit before taxes rose to 35.2 million litas in the first five months of the year compared to 23.8 million litas in the same period in 1996.
Deputy chief accountant Janina Zarembiene also told Reuters that profit before tax was 2.8 million litas in May.

The company reported last month a net profit of 23.7 million litas for the first five months of the year but said it was expecting a decrease after the winter season was over and pipeline mainainance expenses rise sharply.

"We plan that the company will operate at a loss in June because of the high costs of maintenance works although we intend to finish the second quarter of the year with a profit too," Zarembiene said.
The company said earlier it was pinning its hopes on a government decision to raise prices for natural gas from July otherwise it saw little hope of finishing the year with a profit.
